formalText: Their dad's coming home tomorrow, they don't know how it is going to go.
They read books to distract themselves from reality.
They made the mistake of looking into their voicemail yesterday.
They have been ignoring this guy from the ambulance company and then another message was they actually didn't make it through all the messages because they were freaking out too much.
They also had a message about a job from when they were in the hospital in January offering them a job interview.
They started freaking out about it.
They have been trying to talk about anxiety and they feel like they have been trying to act like it's not as much of a big deal as it is, but it's just really devastating for them.
They constantly feel on the verge of just getting into huge trouble over something.
They question why their life it is this way.
They were nervous to go out with some friends, but it went well and better once they were there.

There was two messages from this guy with the ambulance company has been this whole thing where Blue Cross said, they weren't going to pay for any of the ambulance from one of those times one of the times they were in the hospital because it was like a non-emergency thing and even though so they had to write a grievance to them to say while they didn't have the option of refusing to take the ambulance.
